function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Peri-urbanization of industrial agriculture in the global south","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Higher disease burden in specific subsets of urban populations in the global south","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Intensified animal rearing and complex commodity ’webs’ in the global south","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Domination of techno-scientific concepts over politico-economic factors in delineating causal factors for disease transmission","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inequity in access to basic infrastructure and exposure to environmental contamination","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Spatial segregation of socioeconomic groups leading to disproportionate exposure to environmental toxins and pollutants","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Neighborhood-scale inequities in access to social resources leading to health disparities","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inability to untangle the complexities of multi-factorial pathways through which planning impacts urban health","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Impact of urbanization on zoonoses in the global south","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of redundancy in critical supply chains and services","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Vulnerability to zoonotic disease emergence","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate social adaptive capacity to respond to disturbances","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Urban expansion encroaches on wildlife habitat, creating wuis. human activities in these ’buffer zones’ create stress for wild animals, facilitating viral shedding.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Reduced biodiversity depletes the possibility of alternate hosts for disease transmission.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Animal rearing creates a risk of domesticated animals acting as intermediate hosts for viruses to evolve and infect humans.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of universal access to critical infrastructures increases susceptibility to disease transmission.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Centralized environmental quality improvement is needed to reduce stresses that exacerbate the impact of shocks.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Zoonotic disease emergence and interspecific disease transmission","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Family of super spreaders causing second wave of infections","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Reliance on community volunteers for disaster response","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Transfer of surveillance data management to a u.s. consultancy","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of adaptive governance leading to ineffective response to the pandemic","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Weak social capital and lack of trust in the community","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate decentralization of control in healthcare systems","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Panic buying behavior during crises","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate disaster response planning","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate redundancy in production lines or supply chains may lead to disruptions in crucial product availability during a contagious disease outbreak.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate redundancy in data gathering and monitoring systems for covid-19 may result in incomplete or delayed information about hotspots and infected areas, leading to uncontrolled spread of the disease.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate redundancy in food supply chains may lead to shortages and hoarding behavior, exacerbating the impact of contagious diseases on vulnerable populations.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Persistence of pathogens or vectors in soil, water, and pollutants","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Healthcare product shortages in high-income nations","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Dependence on global commodity chains with low cost, just-in-time inventory, and specialized divisions of labor","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Contaminated water sources provide breeding grounds for disease-carrying mosquitoes, increasing the risk of malaria and dengue transmission.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Air pollution, including particulate matter and other pollutants, has been linked to increased severity and transmission of covid-19.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Complexity in factoring natural birth and death rates of a population","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Complexity in factoring spatial movement of populations","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Compartmentalization complexity in epidemic models","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Superspreading events leading to majority transmission of covid-19","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"High population density facilitating disease transmission","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lockdowns reducing community transmission but halting economic activity","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of housing leading to overcrowding, increasing contact rate and disease transmission","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of clean water access leading to inability to practice proper hygiene and handwashing","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Open defecation and lack of sanitation leading to fecal-oral transmission of pathogens","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inequalities exacerbating the disease burden for vulnerable populations","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Infrastructure settlement and activity increase human-wildlife interfaces and facilitate interspecific pathogen transmission","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Infrastructure inequities
